shape (which becomes the shape of the output).

Returns the length of each element. For byte strings,
this is the number of bytes, while, for Unicode strings,
it is the number of Unicode code points.

params.outndarray, None, or tuple of ndarray an:
A location into which the result is stored. If provided, it must have
a shape that the inputs broadcast to. If not provided or None,
a freshly-allocated array is returned. A tuple (possible only as a
keyword argument) must have length equal to the number of outputs.

remain uninitialized.

str_len.return:
yndarrayOutput array of ints
This is a scalar ifxis a scalar.

params.itemsizeint, optional:
itemsizeis the number of characters per scalar in the
resulting array.  Ifitemsizeis None, andobjis an
object array or a Python list, theitemsizewill be
automatically determined.  Ifitemsizeis provided andobjis of type str or unicode, then theobjstring will be
chunked intoitemsizepieces.

params.copybool, optional:
If true (default), then the object is copied.  Otherwise, a copy
will only be made if__array__returns a copy, if obj is a
nested sequence, or if a copy is needed to satisfy any of the other
requirements (itemsize, unicode,order, etc.).

params.unicodebool, optional:
When true, the resultingchararraycan contain Unicode
characters, when false only 8-bit characters.  If unicode is
None andobjis one of the following:achararray,an ndarray of typestr_orbytes_a Pythonstrorbytesobject,then the unicode setting of the output array will be
automatically determined.

params.order{‘C’, ‘F’, ‘A’}, optional:
Specify the order of the array.  If order is ‘C’ (default), then the
array will be in C-contiguous order (last-index varies the
fastest).  If order is ‘F’, then the returned array
will be in Fortran-contiguous order (first-index varies the
fastest).  If order is ‘A’, then the returned array may
be in any order (either C-, Fortran-contiguous, or even
discontiguous).

automatically determined.

params.order{‘C’, ‘F’}, optional:
Specify the order of the array.  If order is ‘C’ (default), then the
array will be in C-contiguous order (last-index varies the
fastest).  If order is ‘F’, then the returned array
will be in Fortran-contiguous order (first-index varies the

chararray.description: Provides a convenient view on arrays of string and unicode values.

params.itemsizeint, optional: Length of each array element, in number of characters. Default is 1.

params.unicodebool, optional:
Are the array elements of type unicode (True) or string (False).
Default is False.

params.bufferobject exposing the buffer interfa:
Memory address of the start of the array data.  Default is None,
in which case a new array is created.

params.offsetint, optional:
Fixed stride displacement from the beginning of an axis?
Default is 0. Needs to be >=0.

params.stridesarray_like of ints, optional:
Strides for the array (seestridesfor
full description). Default is None.

params.order{‘C’, ‘F’}, optional:
The order in which the array data is stored in memory: ‘C’ ->
“row major” order (the default), ‘F’ -> “column major”
(Fortran) order.
